page.title: 04AN INSTRUMENT MAKER'S DAY
page.content: I leave the tranquil serenity of Nanstallon to work in a factory,which is in the forefront of today's technology.My day begins at 7a.m.that is the time I get up.I wash and dress and by 7:40 I am ready to leave for work.I never have breakfast.I drive 2 miles to the factory,situated on the outskirts of Bodmin,where I work.The firm manufactures electronic and microwave instruments from raw materials.These are used in {Telecommunications,Radar and Defence {Systems.}My job is to assemble all the many components into a working instrument.I have a half hour for lunch break when I eat my sandwiches. My working day ends at 6p.m.When I get home I have my main daily meal.I go to bed at about 11p.m.In the village district,there is a builder,a plumber, a car mechanic and a carpenter.
